fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Google Analytics key only provides information from  Issues, Settings, Downloads, Wiki, Commit (individual commit page, not commit list), individual Branch page as well. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a google analytics key from Repository Settings.


h3. Expected Results
The Analytics should work on on pages. After checking, we were able to identify that some of the screens were migrated to a new platform and google analytics tracking feature was not migrated.

h3. Actual Results
After checking, we were able to identify that some of the screens were migrated to a new platform and google analytics tracking feature was not migrated.


h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Kindly Assist.
fields.summary: Google Analytics key not working on all pages

fields.description: Self explanatory
fields.summary: Dark Mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page hangs while viewing Pull request with *code block comments* having specific code in _*New pull request experience*_ lab feature
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable _*New pull request experience*_ lab feature
 # Create a Pull request
 # Add a comment in Pull request with code code block
 # Observe that page hangs (as mentioned earlier this issue is observed only for particular code) and become irresponsive
 # The above issue is observed with Chrome ads well as Firefox browsers

h3. Expected Results

Pull request page should load without any issue
h3. Actual Results

Page hangs while viewing Pull request
h3. Workaround

Enable *_Old pull request experience_* lab feature by executing the following instructions -
 * Go to Avatar on lower left corner
 * Select *Bitbucket Labs* option
 * Enable *_Old pull request experience_* lab feature
fields.summary: Page hangs while viewing Pull request having comments with code block

fields.description:
I have pipelines with build steps that are triggered by commits which build artifacts, followed by a manual single deployment step that deploy those artifacts.  I want to be able to make an API call to trigger the deployment step for a pipeline where the build step has passed and now has state.name="IN_PROGRESS" and state.tage.name="PAUSED". 

I can query the API to find repos with pipelines that are ready to deploy, and we want to automate their deployment based on time and other external triggers/criteria.

I could use custom steps instead of deployment steps, but then we'd lose the nice traceability Bitbucket provides for deployment history.  Also we plan to expand this to deploy to multiple environments (e.g. test, stage, prod)

Here's a simplified version of our current pipeline yaml:
default:
  - step:
      script:
        - runBuild.sh
      artifacts:
        - build/**
  - step:
      name: Run Deploy
      deployment: Test
      trigger: manual
      script:
        - runDeploy.sh test
fields.summary: API to trigger a deployment step in a pipeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Bitbucket Cloud users are not able to see the diff of utf-16 files in the Pull Request UI and in the commits/file diff on the UI

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create locally a SQL file with utf-16 format
# Add this file to a repository and push to Bitbucket
# Do any change to this file locally and push it again to Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results

Be able to check the diff between commits/pull requests

h3. Actual Results

Bitbucket considers the .sql files as Binary and doesn't allow the user to check its diff.

h3. Workaround

To work around this issue, it is currently necessary to either:
* Change the SQL format from utf-16 to ascii/utf-8.
* Check the file diff locally
fields.summary: While checking .sql files in the Pull Request and diffs, Bitbucket is considering these files as Binary

fields.description:
Create an API call to query and update google analytics key.

Not having this API call prevents updating repositories in bulk generating lots of manual work.
fields.summary: Create an API call to query and update google analytics key

fields.description:
To ensure all changes are done through pull requests, we set branch permissions so nobody has write access to master. 

The build server needs write access to master to perform version updates on release. 

With Bitbucket Server we could give the build server SSH Key specific branch permissions, but for Bitbucket Cloud we can only set branch permissions for Users and Groups. 

The current workaround is to create a dedicated build user, which is a lot of hassle when integrated with Atlassian Access, SSO, licensing etc. 

Would you please consider letting us add SSH Keys in the Write Access field in Branch Permissions?
fields.summary: Support SSH keys for Branch Permissions

fields.description:
I'm using pact (tool for contract-testing) and variable BITBUCKET_COMMIT in Bitbucket pipelines for define versions of my app.

Faced with different behavior when using "pull-requests" stage. 

Cloning code for "pull-requests" has shortened commit SHA then other stages (branches, default).

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create bitbucket-pipelines.yaml(image: atlassian/default-image:2) with "default" and "pull-request: stage
 # Run stages
 # See Build setup

Example for default stage(SHA = 40 symbols): !image-2020-04-02-10-33-19-055.png!

Example for pull-request stage (SHA = 11 symbols):

!image-2020-04-02-10-32-46-215.png!

As a result for the same commit, variable BITBUCKET_COMMIT has different values.

Suggestion: do a consistent "pull-requests" stage and take 40 symbols commit hash.
fields.summary: Pull-request stage do checkout with short commit hash

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Merge using API with Squash merge strategy doesn't have proper commit message. It doesn't prepare the commit message as it is prepared while doing the merge using Bitbucket UI. This cause the issue doing the merge using API for repositories having *_Require issue keys in commit messages_* feature on.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable *_Require issue keys in commit messages_* feature in repository.
 # Configure _*Default Merge strategy*_ as _*Squash*_ in repository settings in _*Merge strategy*_ section
 # Create a Pull request
 # Merge the Pull request using API as follows - 
{code:java}
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}/merge 
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The merge should happen successfully. The merge commit should be similar to what we have when do the merge using UI as follows - 
{code:java}
Merged in <source branch name> (pull request #<Pull Request Number>)

<Pull Request Title>

<Consolidated list of commit messages of commits in the Pull Request>{code}
h3. Actual Results

The merge doesn't happen successfully and following error is returned
{code:java}
RepoError: pre-receive hook exited with 1

One of your commit messages is missing a valid issue key:
{code}
h3. Workaround

Please use one of the following workaround until the issue is fixed permanently 
 * Use UI to perform merge
 * Disable *Require issue keys in commit messages* before the merge through API and enable it after the merge
 * Specify merge commit having Jira issue key in API call as follows -
{code:java}
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}/merge  -H 'content-type: application/json' --data '{"message": "commit message with issue key"}'
{code}
fields.summary: Squash merge using API doesn't have proper merge commit message

fields.description: Users would like to be able to sort commits for specific dates and export them.
fields.summary: Ability to view and export commits for specific dates and times

fields.description:
Currently, there is no option to integrate Bitbucket withe Super Query.

Use case :

Super Query is used to create queries and the requirement here is to integrate Super query with Bitbucket so that the queries get saved on the Bitbucket repository directly instead of manually storing the queries each time.

superQuery is a Powerful serverless SQL IDE with an AI query optimization engine that can work with Google BigQuery, AWS Athena, Oracle 18c & Microsoft Kusto (AKA data explorer).
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud integration with Super Query

fields.description:
My team is trying to use Confluence for the first time on a project, and I've notices Lots of formatting and features are lost by trying to paste something into Confluence:

You have to go back in and re-add formatting and indentations back into the Confluence page because it right justifies everything.

It flat out removes highlighting.

Charts will not export properly into Word. It turns into an off-the-page mess.

Also inputting Excel charts into Confluence doesn't work properly.

Finally, like most projects we have artifacts that don't translate well into Confluence pages. It would be nice if we could attach them, but I've been warned away from even trying it.
fields.summary: Confluence Formatting Issues: Highlighting, indenting, charts, attachments

fields.description: In hopes that there might be a quick and easy way of editing pipeline schedules since only solution is to delete the pipeline and create a brand new one with the desired configuration.
fields.summary: Quickly edit pipeline schedules

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Logging into Bitbucket with "google contain integrations" add-on enabled causes a logging loop and prevents logging in.
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/google-contain-integrations/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the addon on firefox
 # Try to login to Bitbucket

h3. Expected Results
You would be able to login to Bitbucket.


h3. Actual Results
You are sent back to the login page or you get into an eternal loop if you already logged into your atlassian account first.
 [^video.mov] 
For an user, it was prompting to download a file called "op", this was not reproducible though.
 !image002.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Disable the add-on to be able to login.
fields.summary: Logging into Bitbucket with "google contain integrations" feature enabled causes a logging loop and prevents logging in

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The following page:
* https://bitbucket.org/account/user/username/delete/

(replace username with the username of your own Bitbucket account)

has the text:
{quote}
You can delete your Atlassian account from your Atlassian account profile.
{quote}

The words 'Atlassian account profile' are a link to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility. This page does not have an option to delete the Atlassian account, which can be confusing for users.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change the link 
* from https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/profile-and-visibility
* to https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences

which is the page that actually has the option to delete the Atlassian account.

It may also be useful to show the Atlassian account email in this page, so the user can make sure they are logged in to the Atlassian account they want to delete, without having to switch between tabs to find it out.
fields.summary: Chang the the page that opens when someone wants to delete their Bitbucket account

fields.description: Currently, we have a Data residency feature in [Confluence & JIRA|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/understand-data-residency-and-realms/] and it would be great to have this feature in Bitbucket cloud as well so that user can select which region they wish to store their Bitbucket data.
fields.summary: Bitbucket cloud Data residency

fields.description: It would be great to have team permissions that allow users to grant other users permissions (perhaps any type of permission equal or lower than yours?) without having to grant these users team administrator permission.
fields.summary: Create team permissions to manage access under administration level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you pushed with a commit message that has a Jira issue link after a URL, the commit's page format combines it like a single URL. 
 !commit_message.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Push a commit with the message below
** {code:java}
test commit message via Git commands https://bitbucket.org/testurl MP-2
{code}
(i) *MP-2* is a Jira issue key
# Check the commit's page - https://bitbucket.org/srstaging/commit_message_url_test/commits/85d8385fcfbb9af4de359c312c4856b01a2ecb68
# Notice that the URL and the Jira issue key were not separated or don't have space.
**  !commit_message.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The URL and the Jira issue key hyperlink is separated with space

h3. Actual Results
The URL and the Jira issue key combines like a single URL

h3. Workaround
For now, we can add the issue key in the first part of the commit message.
*E.g.:*
{code:java}
MP-2 - test commit message via Git commands https://bitbucket.org/testurl
{code}
fields.summary: Commit message with a Jira issue key after a URL combines it like a single URL

fields.description:
Currently, the developer has to create an app to verify the JWT token so it's hard for the developer to verify the token.

It'd be great if we can link the public API key which then can link up to JWT token for private keys.
fields.summary: Expose public API key via an endpoint

fields.description:
The new overview screen of Bitbucket just shows the last 5 viewed repo, leaving the whole page blank. Whoever came up and approved that design should clarify on their thought process and possibly revert it.

This is how my overview page looks [https://ibb.co/sFw703x]
Note that I've access to 100s of repo [https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/repositories]
fields.summary: Ugly unuseful overview screen

fields.description:
Hello,

we have many Steps we need to do when we create a new Repository for a customer. (Permission Config, Branch Structure) These Steps are every time the same procedure.

It would be nice if there is a way to create Templates for that.

Yours sincerely,

Jan-Phillip Oesterling
fields.summary: Templates for Repositorys

fields.description:
When typing commit messages with characters such as below:
Did work for issue 12345.
*Did task A
*Did task B

Bitbucket commit page would interpret change Did task A to italic due to Markdown text being enabled on that page.
The same behavior would not be seen within the commit itself. 

Since using asterisks in Git commit messages to itemize seems to be one of the established conventions the user believe the markdown text formatting should be removed from the commit page.
fields.summary: Remove Markdown text formatting from commit page

fields.description: I am a scientist, and I have links to my old Mercurial repositories in multiple academic publications, which I cannot change. I understand that keeping the repositories frozen or read-only after the end of support for Mercurial might be infeasible. However, I would greatly appreciate an option of putting permanent redirects from my Mercurial repositories to their up-to-date Git versions. That way, links in my publications will still resolve, while Atlassian won't need to keep anything Mercurial-related alive.
fields.summary: Permanent redirect for discontinued Mercurial repositories

fields.description: Currently, the pipeline is hosted in east-1 so it would be great if we can have a selection of host locations for the user to select so that they can improve their build time used.
fields.summary: Ability to select/change pipeline AWS region.

fields.description: Currently, if the user wishes to view the head commit they'll have to view it from the commit-graph or manually select the branch from the drop-down menu. This is essentials since other git apps show which commit head in the ui.
fields.summary: Commit tab should show head commit for each active branch.

fields.description:
In general, it would be nice to be able to configure which "modules" are
shown on *dashboard/overview*, and also let the users choose between the old and the new view.
fields.summary: Configure modules on dashboard/overview page.

fields.description: As the team accounts grow, having to add each user on each group or repository is a MASSIVE undertaking for team account administrators. This could be lessened by adding an feature to provide bulk access with a CSV file.
fields.summary: Add the abillity to grant permission to multiple groups/respositories using CSV file

fields.description: In order to better manage the team accounts and repositories, it would be great if the users with write access could set the branch permissions since currently, only admins are able to manage that, and in some scenarios, some users need to set this kind of permissions but are not supposed to be admins of the Team.
fields.summary: Enable "write-access" users to set branch permission.

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently the Bitbucket user uploads directs to bbuseruploads.s3.amazonaws.com which does not have IPv6 support.

As per [https://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/s3.html] please use the follwing endpoint, which has IPv6 support.

*bbuseruploads.s3.dualstack.us-east-1.amazonaws.com*

Thanks.
fields.summary: Add IPv6 Support for S3 Buckets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The avatar and user name are not displaying on the UI. Instead, the avatar is replaced with the generic user and the name is replaced with the user's Atlassian ID.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Unable to reproduce on demand
 * The issue occurs is intermittently

h3. Expected Results
 * User's avatar and name should be consistently displayed 

h3. Actual Results
 * Occasionally the avatar and user name disappears

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User avatar and name not displaying intermittently

fields.description:
As the title says, when attempting to add an inline comment, the button that shows up on the diff screen is a bit too small and hard to hit, which can be frustrating.

This feature request is to increase the size of the "+" button to add an inline comment to at least 20% of its current size.
fields.summary: Inline comments button for diffs is way too small

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to see entire file contents in side-by-side diff with new Pull request view. This was possible with Old Pull request view.

It's possible to click the "..." to view more rows. However, this only adds a few lines at a time (and is very slow). If users have hundreds of rows between two sections, It takes longer time to view the entire file
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Pull request in New Pull request view
 # Clink on "..." button in Pull request and select *_view side-by-side_* option
 # Observe that user can only see the sections of code with actual changes instead of the entire file

h3. Expected Results

User should have an option to view the entire file in *_view side-by-side_*
h3. Actual Results

User can only see the sections of code with actual changes instead of the entire file
h3. Workaround

the following steps can be done:
 1) Open the repository
 2) Click on the + button
 3) Click on the "Compare branches or tags"
 4) Change the source + destination branch according to the PR where user would like to compare the diffs
 5) Click on the "Diff" button
 6) Click on "Side-by-side" diff

Or, enable *_Old pull request view_* Lab feature by selecting Avatar on the lower left corner and select *_Lab features_* option
fields.summary: Unable to see entire file contents in side-by-side diff with new PR view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As per the bug described in BCLOUD-19630,  The Pull requests page of the repo shows a spinner, when the user is logged out of bitbucket.org.

The user will be required to open a new tab, typing in bitbucket.com, clicking login waiting for everything to auto redirect and auto login, then closing the tab and refreshing the original one again.

h3. Suggested Solution
Please add a login button to be shown on Bitbucket Cloud as soon as the session is invalidated, so the user is aware of the login invalidation and at the same time it will reduce the number of steps the user will need to take to start working again.
fields.summary: In regards to BCLOUD-19630, please add a login button

fields.description:
As per the title, if you attempt to go to https://bitbucket.org/organization/project-name/addon/pipelines, you will be redirected to a 404 page, causing some confusion on users who typed in the URL manually.

It would be good to redirect users to https://bitbucket.org/organization/project-name/addon/pipelines/home instead.
fields.summary: Redirect https://bitbucket.org/<organization>/<project-name>/addon/pipelines/ to pipelines home

fields.description:
Bitbucket pipelines has a host of environment variables which are certainly used by users to configure them. But, unfortunately they would need to revisit the [default variables documentation| https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/variables-in-pipelines-794502608.html#Variablesinpipelines-Repositoryvariables] to pick their variable of choice.

Also, happens that at times users create the variable with the same name but holds a different value.

Hence, it would be more convenient for users if it's made available as a search/drop down over the UI. Make it it much more accessible to users and reduce user friction.
fields.summary: Make global environment variables available in UI over a drop down/easy access

fields.description:
Currently, if you go to your *repository > Settings > Access keys page*, you can add your public SSH key to clone the repo but with read-only access permission (which means you can only clone/pull the repo).

Now, if you want to administer your repository (with write access) via public SSH key, you'll have to go to your team/individual account in order to add your public SSH key (to clone/pull/push) unknowingly on the same page.

*Feature Request:*
 To make the UI more intuitive, it would be best if we could add a notification on the repository *Access Keys* page that will redirect users to add their public SSH key on their account level SSH key if they want to administer the repository with write access permission.



*Sample Notification:*
{panel:bgColor=#fffae6}
(!) *Important*:
 Please be advised that this page is only for granting read access to your repository via public SSH key.
 If you want to administer your repository with *_write_* access permission, please go to your [account level SSH key|https://bitbucket.org/user-account-settings-url] settings instead.
{panel}
fields.summary: Account SSH key notification in the repository Access keys page

fields.description:
Downloading a pipeline artifact using Safari does not work if the user has made certain choices in Preferences for Pop-up Windows on websites. The default preference setting of "Block and Notify" also creates difficulty.

!image-2020-03-18-15-05-37-010.png!

Pipelines should download artifacts in a way that does not require a pop-up window to display. For example, the "Download raw build log" does not create a pop-up window, and works regardless of the user's Safari preference setting.

!image-2020-03-18-15-08-55-487.png!

!image-2020-03-18-15-09-06-403.png!

To fully support Safari, Bitbucket pipelines should download pipeline artifacts in the same way.
fields.summary: Support for pipeline artifact downloads in Safari

fields.description:
I would like to edit the details of a pull request after it has been merged. A common scenario requiring this would be adding a Jira key to the title or simply correcting the wording in the description for future reference.

If there is an argument for allowing the locking of these details (audit maybe), then perhaps this could be a setting per project.
fields.summary: Allow editing of basic details of closed pull requests (e.g. title/description)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Intermittently, builds will not update on the user interface of the user who is watching a build until a page reload happens.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run a Pipelines build normally
 # Intermittently, the build will not show live updates of the commands it is currently running

h3. Expected Results
If you are watching a Pipelines build, the page will show live updates of whichever command is running at that moment.

h3. Actual Results
Pipelines keeps spinning forever on the build setup step, until a page refresh happens.

h3. Workaround
Reload the page. If the Pipelines is finished, the build will be updated with the commands it has run.
fields.summary: Pipelines websockets not updating builds live

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Displaying Behind/Ahead for commits pointing to multiple branches causes the number(Behind/Ahead) to double by the number of branches
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create branch1, branch2 and branch3 - three branch from master branch
# Make two commits on the master branch
# Observe the Branches page. You will see that all three branch are 6 commit behind master instead of two commits

h3. Expected Results
You would see 2 commits behind master
h3. Actual Results
You see 6 commits behind master (2 commits * 3 branches)

h3. Workaround

 # Open the specific branch (any of the branch) and it will display only the commits ahead/behind of it in regards to the destination branch
 # Check the commits ahead/behind locally using git rev-list --left-right --count branch1...branch2
fields.summary: Displaying Behind/Ahead for commits pointing to multiple branches causes the number(Behind/Ahead) to double by the number of branches

fields.description:
Currently, there's no option to add yourself as a watcher of all repositories in a workspace.

This would be useful for workspaces that own a large number of repos, where users need to ass themselves as a watcher in each one.
fields.summary: Ability to watch all repositories in a workspace

fields.description: On the Pull request index screen, add an additional column to display the related Jira ticket status.
fields.summary: Display jira status on pull request index page

fields.description:
Please have an option where we can set the closure option for source branches as checked or unchecked. 
 !image-2020-03-17-19-55-31-615.png|thumbnail! 

This option would ideally be able to set a default behaviour while creating a PR.
fields.summary: Option to Set default Close Source Branch Option

fields.description:
You should be able to set the default repo in the settings.
Reason Behind Feature Request : When you have a new forked (current) repo and you create a pull request that pull request is incorrectly pointing to the original repo
It would be good to make this optional to avoid mistakes.
fields.summary: Default Repository During Pull Requests

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for a branch in "Target branch" dropdown under "pull requests" returns maximum 10 number of branch instead of all branch fulfilling search criteria
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on Pull requests tab on left pane
 # Assume you have 13 branches named branch1, branch2, branch3...branch13. This is just for this example.
 # Specify "Branch" in Target Branch dropdown
 # Observe you will see only 10 branch listed in alphabetic order

h3. !Screen Shot 2020-03-16 at 1.52.51 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

The result should display all branch fulfilling the search criteria, branch through branch13
h3. Actual Results

The result display only 10 branch in alphabetic order fulfilling the search criteria
h3. Workaround

Use the following URLs to retrieve the Pull requests 
 * Open Pull request with Target branch as branch - 
https://bitbucket.org/<repo_owner_name>/<repo_name>/pull-requests/?state=OPEN&at=branch

 * Merged Pull request with Target branch as branch - 
https://bitbucket.org/<repo_owner_name>/<repo_name>/pull-requests/?state=MERGED&at=branch

 * Declined Pull request with Target branch as branch - 
https://bitbucket.org/<repo_owner_name>/<repo_name>/pull-requests/?state=DECLINED&at=branch
fields.summary: Searching for a branch  in "Target branch" under "Pull requests" returns maximum 10 branch

fields.description: I would appreciate the option to make whitespace and other invisible characters, such as line returns, visible. This option should be separate from the option to ignore whitespace characters in diffs.
fields.summary: Add separate user option to make whitespace characters visible

fields.description:
This one should be simple to do.

Add some sort of popover (even the standard HTML {{title}} would do), so that when file paths are truncated (e.g. paths like {{starting / file / path / ... / ending / file / path.extension}}).

Adding this will make it much easier to see the file path, and should not impede any existing functionality. I understand that you can see the same info in the right panel, but it is common practice in many content spaces, that when a truncated value is presented, that the full value is accessible via hover.

I frequently find myself trying to hover over the file paths to see the full path.
fields.summary: Show full file path on hover in pull request

fields.description:
It would be good to have a way to cancel or set as `failed` an existing pipeline run that is sitting at a manual run step.

There are occasions where you notice the build has errors and you have to kick off a new build, leaving the existing pipeline run(s) in the paused state forever.
fields.summary: Allow cacelling Pipelines waiting manual steps

fields.description:
When a push is made to a ref, we generate a lock file to prevent parallel write on the same ref.
Sometimes this operation is cancelled on the user side and the lock file never gets released in the server side of the repository.

Users would like to get notified when this happens so they can reach out to support to remove this lock and prevent any further disruption on their product usage such as while merging pull requests.

Also, it would be great if it was implemented a feature to also remove this locks which could be triggered automatically or by the users itself.
fields.summary: Generate a notification to repository administrators when a lock file is not automatically removed

fields.description:
Currently users get a generic error when a pull request merge fails.

Also, if the pull request is merged locally, it is provided a more detailed information than what is given in Bitbucket UI.
fields.summary: Provide more detailed information why the pull request failed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the Old pull request UI, when you try merging a PR that has conflicts, it shows the popup that has the steps to be followed. Whereas in the new Pull request UI it does not show the pop-up
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Try to merge a PR that has merge conflict.
 * Old PR UI Screenshot:

!image-2020-03-13-20-02-10-213.png|width=476,height=210!
 * New PR UI Screenshot:

!image-2020-03-13-20-02-36-214.png|width=489,height=242!
 * Also, note that if the account is on the *Premium plan,* we do not see the pop-up even in the old pull request UI. 

Premium plan UI Screenshot: When you click on Merge, there is no popup.

   !image-2020-03-13-20-03-19-192.png|width=543,height=161!
h3. Expected Results

Merge conflict modal must pop up in the new Pull request UI.
h3. Actual Results

Merge conflict modal does not pop up in the new Pull request UI.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Merge conflict modal does not pop up in the new Pull request UI.

fields.description: As per the title, this feature request is to upgrade the atlassian/default-image to the latest version of git (2.17.x), which includes a few new features that are unavailable on 2.7.4
fields.summary: Upgrade Atlassian/default-image to the latest version of git

fields.description:
Currently, the name of the commit author will show up when a repository is public.

This feature request is to add the ability to hide this information on Bitbucket's UI.
fields.summary: Add the ability to hide names for commits on public repositories

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to show Component and Label on stories ONLY if there's data in the field. So on stories where not Component or Label are relevant, it won't display "None." This will help boards be less busy and allow me to focus on the important information.

We're using Component and Label fields to indicate things that are only relevant to a small portion of our stories. So having the majority of stories display "None" "None" makes it hard to identify the stories that we really need to track.
fields.summary: Allow Component and Label view toggle on stories

fields.description: I have started Kotlin development and understand itis a new language, but it is fairly easy to add Kotlin coloring to the code in the WYSIWYG editor. Please implement it!
fields.summary: Please add Kotlin auto code coloring to Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The comments made on a pull request not submitted gets lost if the screen size is reduced beyond a certian threshold and the user has to start over again

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 : Write a comment on the pull request and don't submit it just yet
 # Step 2 : Proceed to recude the window size and you will notice that the comment is lost

h3. Expected Results

The message should still exist despite the shrink in window size

h3. Actual Results

The comment is lost

{noformat}
h3. Workaround

We currently don't have a work around for this
fields.summary: Pull request comment get lost over window resize

fields.description:
We currently have a team of approx 10 devs, and we are running automated tests in Bitbucket pipelines every time we do a GIT push to Bitbucket (which is often).  (the trigger is just a branch trigger)

 

We also use custom triggered pipelines for running code analysis and 2 other custom pipelines for deploying to UAT and for deploying to Prod. 

 

Because of the number of Pipelines that our team runs, it makes it very difficult to find a particular pipeline that was run by another member in the team more than a few days ago.

 

E.g scenarios.
 # I want to know who the last person was who deployed to production and find the pipeline that did this.  -  ability to filter pipelines screen by the name of the custom pipeline (not just being able to filter by Manual) would solve this
 # I know who has ability to deploy to prod,   but I still can't easily find their pipelines that did deployments - ability to filter pipelines screen by the USER who ran/triggered the pipeline and not just being able to filter by 'Only Mine'
 # I want to be able to see a history of all deployments to production (not just the most recent one)

 

Suggestions:
 # Provide ability to filter / search the Pipelines screen in Bitbucket by:
 ## User  (not just only mine)
 ## Pipeline name (as shown below)
!image-2020-03-12-09-17-05-371.png!
 ## Tags
fields.summary: Improve Search / Filter abilities for Pipelines

fields.description: When initially inviting Bitbucket Cloud to a Slack group, the first notification, designed to be an example, causes clutter and often confusion. Please add the possibility to disable this message.
fields.summary: Allow disabling Initial Slack integration message

fields.description: I don't want to know if I am connected to the Internet or not. These toasts are annoying
fields.summary: Option to disable internet connectivity banners

fields.description:
It would be really great if the customers could set which kind of notifications they want for each e-mail address associated with their Bitbucket Cloud Account. 

Like set which teams/PRs/repositories are going to trigger the notification to each e-mail address.
fields.summary: Custom email routing

fields.description:
It would be great to have a way to setup upper limits to extra build minutes.

Currently once you have setup an account with overages there is no way to limit the amount of minutes used by the team account.
fields.summary: Include upper limits for Bitbucket pipelines build minutes
Pipelines repository variable, simple improvement.

fields.description:
It's possible to set up third-party LFS providers using the .lfsconfig file in Bitbucket Cloud.

In this case though, when using a third-party LFS provider, Bitbucket's UI will not load the files from LFS, being unable to display them, and will also show that there are no LFS files on the Settings > Git LFS page.

This feature request is to add support for third-party LFS providers on the UI.
fields.summary: Support for third-party LFS providers on Bitbucket's UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Printing wiki page in Firefox browser will truncate the other page if it's longer then 1 page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a long wiki that is more than 1 page
 # Print preview the page or print it in Firefox web browser
 # The page is truncated to only 1 page

h3. Expected Results
The page will show more than 1 page
h3. Actual Results
The page is showing 1 page only and truncate the other page

h3. Workaround
Print on a different web browser such as Chrome or Safari
fields.summary: Printing wiki page in Firefox browser will truncate the other page if it's longer then 1 page

fields.description:
Hi,

I was trying to use the BITBUCKET_BRANCH env var as part of the config for a given step but I was not able to do so : 

_The environment '$BITBUCKET_BRANCH' in your bitbucket-pipelines.yml doesn’t match any environment defined in your settings. Either update your yml, or your settings, to use the same name._

What I was trying to do :

 
{code:java}
branches: 
  '{master,dev,staging}': 
    - step: 
        name: Update ECS Service 
        deployment: $BITBUCKET_BRANCH   <----- HERE
        <<: *UpdateECSService
{code}
 

 

I had to split my steps for each environment and explicitly refer to the deployment (in my case name of the branch = name of the deployment)  : 
{code:java}
branches:    
  dev:      
    - step :       
      <<: *updateECSService
      deployment: dev
{code}
Thanks in advance

RG
fields.summary: Use environment variables in step config

fields.description:
Right now I can rerun failed steps, thats awesome! However, sometimes I would like to re-run a successful step as well.

 

For instance, I have a deployment that goes, and then the next step is a set of automated tests I would like to run. Currently, if I do a redeploy of that application, that test step doesn't run because it is a successful step, I would have to rerun the whole pipeline to get what I needed.

 

Another scenario is I want to rerun the tests because maybe my environment or underlying infrastructure has changed, but I don't necessarily want to redeploy the application, I just want to run the tests again to verify that the service is indeed still healthy. 

 

Having the ability to rerun that test step, even when marked as successful, would be greatly beneficial and a common component in most other build services (i.e. Jenkins, gitlab, CircleCI)
fields.summary: Ability to rerun a successful step

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if a user disconnect while on the Bitbucket website the disconnected popup will show up and unable to be acknowledged or close until a page is refresh.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Bitbucket website
 # Disconnect from the internet
# The website will show "Disconnected" warning popup and no acknowledge or way to close it

h3. Expected Results
The user able to acknowledge it and close
h3. Actual Results
The user unable to acknowledge the popup until refresh

h3. Workaround
Refresh the web browser.
fields.summary: Disconnecting from internet while on Bitbucket website cause the Disconnect notification popup to stuck on the page

fields.description:
You can use the API entry [/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/statuses/build|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/statuses/build] to add the status of a build to a commit but, at this moment, it is not possible to remove the build status once it is added.

It would be good to have an API entry to remove build satus from commits.
fields.summary: Add API call to remove build status from commits

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While merging Pull Requests, we are getting the message "something went wrong" on the first time that we try to do it but, it works properly on the second time that we select "Merge".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a TEAM account TEAM1 with two users user1 and user2
 * Create a repository REPO1 in TEAM1 team account. Let both users user1 and user2 be admin access to this repository
 * User user1 creates a fork of REPO1 repository in TEAM1 account to his personal account. User1 remove access to other users in the forked repository and have access to himself only
 * User user1 create branch branch1 in repository REPO1 forked in his personal account and make some changes in the branch
 * User user1 create a Pull request from user1/branch1 to master (TEAM account repository). User1 check the option in the Pull request to delete the source branch after the merge in
 * User user2 access REPO1 in TEAM1 account and try to merge the pull request
 * Observe that user2 get "something went wrong" error
 * Trying to merge the second time successfully merge the Pull request 

h3. Expected Results

* User2 shouldn't be able to merge the PR and should be presented with a user-friendly error message at the time of merge something like "You can't merge the Pull request as you don't have permission to delete the source branch which has been configured to be deleted after the merge"

h3. Actual Results

In the first try to merge changes the user receives the error message "something went wrong" and, in the second try, he/she succeed to merge the pull request, even tho he/she should not be able to do it.

h3. Workaround

# Use "Old PR view" (or disable the "New PR view" add-on)
# Try to merge a second time
fields.summary: While merging Pull Requests, we are getting the message "something went wrong"

fields.description: in documentation [here]([https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/src#post]), what's idea about create requests with header of `"Content-Type": "application/json"`, mabey body of json also a good choice.
fields.summary: support add new file or update file with "Content-Type": "application/json"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently with Bitbucket Cloud, we do not have a way to track what merge strategy was used (commit, FF merge or Squash merge). Currently do not support Revert for PRs that was merged using Squash merge, but present the user with the Option anyways in the UI. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a branch off Main branch of the repo
 # Add commits to the newly created branch
 # Create a PR and merge that PR into a Main branch using Squash merge strategy
 # Then try to revert it, you will be presented with the following error msg, depending on the View you are using (old vs new Pr view)

!Screen Shot 2020-03-06 at 9.32.25 AM.png!
h3. Expected Results

Provide support for PR Revert for when Squash merge strategy was used. Or remove the Revert option for those PRs. 
h3. Actual Results

We return 400 error in the console when trying to revert Squash merge 
h3. Workaround

The workaround currently is to do a PR revert locally and then push changes to Bitbucket remote repo.
fields.summary: Support Revert for Pull Requests that were merged using Squash Merge strategy

fields.description:
Hi,

 

Bitbucket supports automatic downstream branch merges _as long as you use semantic versioning_. We have a simpler setup without release candidates, and simply have a develop and master branch, a model Bitbucket is aware of and supports.

 

It would be great if that, on the rare occasion we need to hotfix master, it automatically get merged down to develop. Currently we do a new PR from master to develop after every hotfix but this is something that could be considered unnecessary - we release from master so if we already PRd directly into master, that supersedes what is in develop and will always need to be applied.

 

As I say, Bitbucket already supports a complex version of this flow, this is a request to also support the simpler version :) 

 

Many thanks.
fields.summary: Automatic branch merging from master > develop

fields.description:
Do you plan to add tagging of pull requests? We have many pull requests in pull requests overview which are waiting for something. It would be great if we could see column Tags for example next to column Reviewers.

Now person who oversees the repository must open every single pull request and check the status. If he could see it from overview, it would save him a lot of time.
fields.summary: Pull request tagging

fields.description:
This is request to implement BSERV-3141 also for Bitbucket Cloud.

Some branch maintenance requires the ability to pull from an annotated tag (such as in the case of a QA certified commit) to downstream branches (our branchmasters use stash for convenience). Please consider including a tab in the "source" combo box choice for tags as well as branches.
fields.summary: Allow Pull Requests to source from a tag or commit as well as a branch

fields.description: Currently, the user configures a build that has multiple steps, for example, build > test > merge. The last steps merge is manual steps which will be run if the test success or giving the needed result and if it's not they wish to delete the build so that it won't be merge accidentally.
fields.summary: Ability to delete existing pipeline build that has manual step

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User unable to click Run pipeline in the pipeline tab as the button is grey out with error "To run pipeline you need write permission"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any of the current pipeline builds
 # Hover mouse to Run pipeline, the button is grey out.

h3. Expected Results
* The button is not grey out if the user has the correct permission.
h3. Actual Results
* The button is grey out and user unable to run the pipeline

h3. Workaround
* Workaround is to click any of the previous Pipeline builds and go back to the pipeline tab, the button should now be accessible.
fields.summary: Unable to click "Run pipeline" on the pipeline tab as it's grey out.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per the title, when triggering a Pipelines build using the API, and providing a base64 encoded file larger than 93K in size, Pipelines will keep spinning forever on the build setup phase, and will never really start, failing on the two-hour mark as "System error"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a file larger than 93K to provide as a parameter
# Run an API call like this, to encode the file and trigger the Pipelines build:
{code}
curl -X POST -is -H "Authorization: Basic $BITBUCKET_AUTH_KEY" -H 'Content-Type: application/json' https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/<repoOwner>/<Repo>/pipelines/ -d "{\"target\":{\"type\":\"pipeline_ref_target\",\"ref_type\":\"branch\",\"ref_name\":\"master\",\"selector\":{\"type\":\"custom\",\"pattern\":\"run-build\"}},\"variables\":[
{\"key\":\"file\",\"value\":\"$(base64 -w 0 mylargefile.json)\"}
]}"
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The build triggers normally on Pipelines

h3. Actual Results
The build keeps spinning forever on the build setup phase, and ends up timing out.

h3. Workaround
Instead of passing the file as a variable, add it to your repository or fetch it from somewhere else.
fields.summary: Triggering a Pipelines build through the API with a file larger than 93K in size as a parameter makes the build get stuck

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markdown files using mixed lists are not properly rendered. Mixed lists with numbered lists are rendered as a single line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a markdown file on Bitbucket
# Add a mixed list with numbered list to the file, such as:
#* {code}
- This is a test for Bitbucket cloud
1. This is numbered list 1
2. This is numbered list 2
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Entries being rendered as a list

h3. Actual Results
The numbered list is rendered as a single line.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Markdown mixed list are rendered as a single line

fields.description:
When attempting to follow the steps below to add a user to either a group or to a repository:
1. Settings of a repo
2. Users and groups
3. Add a space, and then type in the desired e-mail address

No users will be found to add to the repo or group.
This feature request is to ignore spaces in the user search for e-mail addresses, as this would cause some confusion as to why a user is not being found.
fields.summary: Show users on users and groups regardless of preceding spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The app [Sonar for Bitbucket Cloud App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214134/sonar-for-bitbucket-cloud+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=my] is used to generate pull request comments for found code issues.

The markdown for the generated pull request comment does not render correctly on the new PR UI but it does render on the old PR UI:
 

However, it does 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the [Sonar for Bitbucket Cloud App|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1214134/sonar-for-bitbucket-cloud+&cd=1&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=my] app.
 # Configure the app as per https://github.com/mibexsoftware/sonar-bitbucket-plugin
# The app will then generate a pull request comment to highlight issues found in the pull request.

h3. Expected Results
 The comment will render correctly in the PR UI like this: 
 !image-2020-03-05-19-17-47-878.png|thumbnail! 
(i) Note that the screenshot is generated from the old PR UI

h3. Actual Results

The PR comment will have a really weird format in the new PR UI:
!image-2020-03-05-19-27-43-615.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-03-05-19-28-05-303.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There is no known workaround to make it look as intended on the new PR UI. 
The user will need to switch to the old PR UI if they want to look at the generated comment with the proper format.
fields.summary: The markdown for the comments generated by the Sonar for Bitbucket Cloud App does not render correctly in the new PR UI.

fields.description:
Please consider having a feature where a user can send private replies (if wanted) for public issue trackers. 
This would enable users to have a hybrid system where the issue tracker is public, but some sensitive information can still be shared. 

Kindly assist.
fields.summary: Private Replies to Public Issue Tracker

fields.description:
Hi,


We are planning to migrate tortoisesvn to bitbucket.Do we have any plugin to migrate it.Can we migrate with History ?

Regards
Mohan
fields.summary: How to migrate tortoisesvn to bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, if you're using the Safari browser, you can't open the Jira issue key popup due to _Prevent cross-site tracking_ enabled in Safari by default.

This behavior is noted as a limitation for Safari users in our official documentation. - [Reference issues in your development work - Jira Software Cloud - Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/reference-issues-in-your-development-work/]

{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
(i) Safari users
If you have Prevent cross-site tracking enabled in Safari, you won't be able to open Jira issues in the same tab or window. To view the issue, open it in a different tab or window.
{panel}

*Feature Request:*
In this case, I believe it would be best for us to open the Jira issue a new tab rather than in a popup.
fields.summary: Option to open Jira Issue key in a new tab on Safari browser

fields.description:
Hi,

The merge strategy for my repo is "Squash". 

Since I squash a number of commits, the commit message results in a log of all commits which is usually long and not helpful.

I'd like to have the description of the PR become the commit message.

I tried looking for a feature that will help me achieve this, but didn't find any.

I'd appreciate your input on this as well as other suggestions to solve my problem,

Issue opened after I was requested in this community thread:

[https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Is-there-a-way-to-make-the-PR-description-become-the-commit/qaq-p/1316509?utm_campaign=mentions_answer&utm_content=post&utm_medium=email&utm_source=atlcomm#M52326]

Thanks!
fields.summary: Make the PR description become the commit message

fields.description: I am signed into Bitbucket and recently something was changed so it signs me out several times a day and I have to constantly relog in. It's infuriating as it will just stop working and then you have to remember to log out, log in, and then find the page you were originally on. Happens for the whole team who are spread over the world so not isolated to just me.
fields.summary: Dont make me log in many times a day

fields.description:
Hi!

Our team currently likes to estimate our capacity across a 2 week sprint in hours (we do this in a spreadsheet). We then estimate hours for each task in JIRA.

Two things that would make our lives easier:
 # Currently we manually count up the total estimated times for tasks in Jira and compare this to our estimated capacity in hours. It would be great to be able to get a forecast of this before we start the sprint. We often take tasks out if we have put in too many tasks with too many hours before we start the sprint. 
 # There does not seem to be a function to remove time logged on a task. This is frustrating as we sometimes make mistakes and we can not easily remove it. 

Cheers, 

Krista
fields.summary: Improvements to time tracking of tasks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I want to merge a PR but there one of the merge checks is not passing, I can not see which one this is. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure some merge checks (e.g. min number of reviewers)
 # Create a PR
 # Try to merge PR

h3. Expected Results

If I can not merge the PR, I should see a list of the merge checks that need to be resolved. This is not the case. I also don't see the list of merge checks in the sidebar. 

 
h3. Actual Results

No list of failed merge checks. 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Not clear which merge check is blocking merge

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to change Slack room subscriptions by following the steps below:
REPOSITORY | Settings | Chat Notifications | Settings | Add Subscription

This is not possible through the API. This feature request is to add this ability in the future.

[~fstefanelli@atlassian.com] - Also, it would be great to add other functionalities such as to query the current slack channels associated with that repository via API.
fields.summary: Add API endpoint to add chat subscriptions

fields.description:
Currently, it's possible to change whether Pipelines is enabled or not by following the steps below:
REPOSITORY > Settings > Pipelines > Settings > Enable Pipelines

This is not possible through the API. This feature request is to add this ability in the future.
fields.summary: Add API endpoint for enabling and disabling Pipelines

fields.description:
Bitbucket UI use [Table of Contents extension|https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/toc/] to render table of contents in markdown files. This extension does provide option to define the range of section levels to include in the Table of Contents. This way user can specify the section levels to be excluded from Table of contents. However, there is no option to do the same in Bitbucket UI.

There should be an option to define the range of section levels to include in the Table of Contents on per Bitbucket user basis.
fields.summary: Provide option to define the range of section levels to include in the Table of Contents

fields.description:
Bitbucket groups are not supported in Pipeline deployment.

Currently there is an option 'Only admin can deploy' which allows only Admin to perform deployment which is not a good enough granular control.

There should be provision to specify Bitbucket groups who can perform deployment into specific environments.

For example -
- Deployment in Development environment can happen by someone in group 'dev', 
- Deployment in UAT environment can happen by someone in group 'qa'
- Deployment in Prod environment can happen by someone in group 'devops'
fields.summary: Bitbucket groups are not supported in Pipeline deployment

fields.description:
We would like Bitbucket to notify us when our Smart link/Smart mirror status change, as for now it is necessary for our users to both:
# Access Bitbucket Cloud instead of the mirror
# Mannually report to us that the link/mirror is not available

These notifications would help us yo keep our Link/Mirror active and aware of its downtimes.
fields.summary: Notifications regarding Smart link/Smart mirror status

fields.description:
While adopting Bibucket Pipelines across our organization (>200 repos) to automate all cloud deployments, we are finding ourselves writing more and more specialized Cloud Infrastructure repositories. 

To automate some of the pipelines checks and configurations (i.e. static code analysis ), we will need a way to differentiate thesetype of  repos from the regular source code oriented ones . Hence the need of "flagging" al I.C. oriented repositories. 
 
One simple approach will be to add the "Infrastructure as Code" option to the Languages selection box, another approach could  be to include an additional field or a tagging mechanism for the repository metadata structure.
fields.summary: Ability to flag a repository as Infrastructure as Code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The unexpected behaviour gives the appearance of content disappearing, however it does seem to be present when you attempt to enter more text.

I tested this in both the new and old PR experiences as well as on Chrome and Firefox.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new codeblock using either triple back ticks or through the toolbar
 # Enter "::" followed by any text 

h3. Expected Results

Text should render as entered inside codeblock
h3. Actual Results

See attached video
h3. Workaround

You can add the text as a single line code statement or without a codeblock.
fields.summary: Inserting a double semicolon at the start of a codeblock in a PR comment causes the text to dissapear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transfering a repository from a personal account to a team account which the personal account has administrator access does not trigger a transfer request notification to this account.
Other administrators receive the transfer request notification.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Transfer the repository from a personal account to a team account which you have administrator access

h3. Expected Results
The user who triggered the repository transfer would receive an email notification.

h3. Actual Results
The user who triggered the repository transfer does not receive an email notification.

h3. Workaround

# Other administrators from the team account accept the transfer
# Refuse the transfer and re-do the transfer request while accepting the transfer on the next page you are re-directed to.
fields.summary: Transfering a repository from a personal account to a team account which the personal account has administrator access does not trigger a transfer request notification

fields.description: If I leave the tab open for a PR or a Jira ticket for a CI job/deploy, it's cuz I'm waiting on feedback, and I want to know as soon as I get it. But I couldn't care less about the latest from whatever random site an article I'm reading happens to be on.
fields.summary: Web push notifications for pull requests

fields.description:
# Add merge conflict icon on in the Pull Request headers. This is very much useful when Pull Request has a higher number of files.
 # Most of the developers do not check diff before creating PRs, and since there is no sign on the top (Which was there in the previous version) it is only detected at the code review level or while merging the PR.
fields.summary: Add merge conflict icon on in the Pull Request headers

fields.description:
Currently, we support HTTP and SSH protocols for Git operations.

However, other users wanted to enforce SSH key-based access and they want to disable password-based access.

*Feature Request:*
I believe It would be useful for us to have the ability to disable password-based Git operations and enforce SSH key-based access.
fields.summary: Ability to enforce SSH based access and disable password based for Git operations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Bitbucket LFS media adapter documentation is broken at the moment:https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/bitbucket-lfs-media-adapter-856699998.html
It's throwing a forbidden error when accessed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Open the documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/bitbucket-lfs-media-adapter-856699998.html

h3. Expected Results
The documentation displays correctly

h3. Actual Results
The following error is thrown:
!Screen Shot 2020-02-28 at 18.55.33.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Documentation for LFS media adapter is throwing a forbidden error (BCCD-481)

fields.description: It would be nice if Bitbucket Pipelines gave some kind of error or warning if searching for artifact patterns do not match any files.
fields.summary: Provide error message when artifact patterns do not match any files
